00015 void random_sleep(int max_usecs) {
00016 
00017         unsigned int t;
00018 
00019         t = 1 + (int) (max_usecs * (rand() / (RAND_MAX + 1.0)));
00020 
00021         usleep( t );
00022 }//
00023 
00024 
00025 int random_sleep_period(struct timeval *start, struct timeval *current, int max_usecs_interval, int max_usecs_total) {
00026 
00027         // if the malloc fails here, there are much bigger problems anyways!
00028         if (NULL==start) {
00029                 start = (struct timeval *) malloc( sizeof(struct timeval) );
00030                 gettimeofday( start, NULL );
00031 
00032                 if (NULL==current) {
00033                         current = (struct timeval *) malloc( sizeof(struct timeval) );
00034                 }
00035         }
00036 
00037         gettimeofday( current, NULL );
00038 
00039         // should we even sleep? ie. is the period over?
00040         suseconds_t diff_usecs = current->tv_usec - start->tv_usec;
00041         if (diff_usecs > max_usecs_total)
00042                 return 1;
00043 
00044         random_sleep( max_usecs_interval );
00045 
00046         return 0;
00047 }//
